Description: Body fragment of large North Ionian pottery bowl. Interior: vari-coloured tongue frieze below frieze of lotus flowers and buds; traces of upper frieze; separating bands with added colour.
Curator's comments: Petrie 1886, 20, may be referring to this fragment as having been found in the sanctuary of Apollo, at level 240, where the Polemarchos vase was also found. However, he mistakenly claims that pl. VI.3 shows the outside of the piece, and so it is not entirely clear to which of the two fragments he refers.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 18, no. U1, pl. VII, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.121)
